96.content: How does the political system work in your country ?
We have hundreds of constituencies and the voters in each one elect a member of parliament . Most people call them mp ’ s .
Each mp belongs to a political party , right ?

Almost all of them do . A few are independent . That means that they do not belong to a party . If one party more than half of the mp ’ s . they form a government . That means that they choose a prime Finist
It ’ s a group of ministers. Each minister is responsible for a department. For example, there ’ s a minister of education, a minister of health, a minister of finance, etc.
Can any mp make a law ?
No. The government has to propose a bill. Then the mp ’ s discuss it and vote on it. If it passes, it becomes a law.
I suppose a proposed a law needs the support of the big political parties .
Yes. If a law is very important, the government may ask the queen to dissolve parliament. Then there ’ s a general election. The party that wins the most seats forms a government.
How do people choose which party or candidate to vote for ?
They listen to the candidates ’ speeches and read the newspapers. They also watch television.
